metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6178 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Eliding from the wrong side in an infobar in DevTools in Google Chrome prior to 68.0.3440.75 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install a malicious extension to Hide Chrome Security UI via a crafted Chrome Extension.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6178` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
